revised_title: Subterranean Damp Accidents in Coal Mines
tldr: This article reports on a series of accidents in a coal mine in Scotland, where workers were killed by subterranean damp, a mixture of air and water vapor. The accidents occurred when workers entered old, abandoned areas of the mine, where fires had been burning for years, releasing toxic fumes. The Royal Society received this report from Sir R. Moray, who shared the story from the Earl of Weymes, a relative of the mine's owner.
